trustfund:
TF051129-PHRD-ALBANIA: POVERTY REDUCTION
            SUPPORT CREDIT II

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability highly likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. This Simplified
            Implementation Completion Report provides findings and
            implications for subsequent operations, and identifies three
            main lessons which can be drawn from the project. First, the
            number of policy reform areas addressed should be limited,
            particularly in an environment of political instability. The
            program for the series should be left more flexible, so as
            not to overburden the last of the series with an excessive
            unfinished agenda. A programmatic series with rotating focus
            from year to year, might better serve this purpose, than a
            series attempting to implement a large number of areas over
            a three-year period. Second, performance monitoring
            indicators should be limited to a core set of indicators
            which reflect what the program aims to achieve, and then
            closely monitored; yet, attention needs to be paid to
            setting up clear baselines from which to measure progress.
            Third, the presence of a strong country office, which
            continuously engages in the dialogue, and provides support
            for implementation, is critical to maintain momentum for
            such operations, as the experience of this project has
            clearly shown.
